skill.name: supabase
skill.description: Navigate Supabase database tables, relationships, and query patterns. Use when you need to understand how tables connect, write queries, or find the right data source.
skill.summary: Navigate Supabase database tables, relationships, and query patterns. Use when you need to understan...
skill.author: Acurioustractor

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown files. No executable code, scripts, network calls, file system access, or environment variable reads. The skill is a knowledge base for database schema reference.

content.value_statement: Supabase database navigation is complex. This skill provides instant access to table relationships, query patterns, and type definitions for your project.
actual_capabilities: Browse 165 database objects including tables, views, and partitions
View table relationships with foreign key constraints
Find TypeScript type definitions for 35 database tables
Access common query patterns and join examples
Locate database functions and RPC calls
limitations: Does not execute queries or modify database state
Does not provide real-time schema validation
Cannot connect to external Supabase projects
Documentation is specific to this project schema

use_cases.title: Build Data Features
use_cases.description: Understand table relationships to implement new features that touch the database

use_cases.title: Write Database Queries
use_cases.description: Find the correct table structure and foreign keys for writing Supabase queries

use_cases.title: Explore Data Model
use_cases.description: Navigate the database schema to understand how data flows through the system

prompt_templates.title: List Tables
prompt_templates.prompt: What tables exist for [feature area] in the Supabase database?

prompt_templates.title: Find Relationship
prompt_templates.prompt: How do [table A] and [table B] connect? Show me the foreign key relationship

prompt_templates.title: Query Example
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a Supabase query to get [data] with [related data] using proper joins

prompt_templates.title: Type Location
prompt_templates.prompt: Where are the TypeScript types for [table name] and what fields do they include?

output_examples.input: How do stories connect to organizations?
output: The stories table also links to: profiles (storyteller_id, author_id), projects, and media_assets

best_practices: Always filter queries by tenant_id for multi-tenant data isolation
Use proper foreign key joins instead of multiple separate queries
Reference the correct TypeScript type file for your domain
anti_patterns: Querying tables without tenant_id filter (breaks data isolation)
Using US spelling in TypeScript types (organisations vs organizations)
Hardcoding values instead of using database functions for complex queries

faq.question: Which Supabase client should I use?
faq.answer: Browser client for React components, Server SSR for API routes, Service Role for admin operations only.

faq.question: How many tables are in the database?
faq.answer: 165 objects including 153 tables, 7 views, and 3 partitions with 35 tables having TypeScript types.

faq.question: Can this skill execute SQL queries?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides documentation and patterns only. Use Supabase MCP tools or API routes to execute queries.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads documentation files. It cannot access, modify, or query any database.

faq.question: Why do some tables show ORPHANED?
faq.answer: Tables without migration files or TypeScript types. They exist in the live database but lack source-controlled definitions.

faq.question: How is this different from Supabase MCP?
faq.answer: This skill provides project-specific documentation. Supabase MCP provides direct database access and query execution.
